perturbation.original_text: Not later than the fifteenth (15th) calendar day of each calendar quarter (or the first business day thereafter), Licensee shall deliver to Licensor (i) a report accurately showing Gross Revenues of the Licensee for the previous quarter, the number of Subscribers on the last day of such previous quarter and the amount of Royalties due thereon, and (ii) payment of the Royalties payable for such previous quarterbased on the Subscriber information as reflected in the report.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall deliver to Licensor (i) a report accurately showing Gross Revenues of the Licensee for the previous quarter, the number of Subscribers on the last day of such previous quarter and the amount of Royalties due thereon, and (ii) payment of the Royalties payable for such previous quarterbased on the Subscriber information as reflected in the report no later than the last day of the subsequent quarter.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates royalty reports and payments within 15 days of the end of each quarter. The modification extends this deadline to the last day of the subsequent quarter, potentially conflicting with state laws requiring more prompt payment schedules and reporting, ensuring licensors get proper and punctual reports. Nevada law requires parties to perform contractual obligations in good faith and can imply reasonable timelines for performance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada Revised Statutes concerning good faith and reasonable performance in contracts.

perturbation.original_text: Thereafter, this Agreement shall renew automatically for one (1) additional three (3) year period (the "Renewal Term" and collectively, together with the Initial Term, the "Term") unless either party provides the other with written notice of non-renewal at least ninety (90) days before the expiration of the Initial Term].
perturbation.changed_text: Thereafter, this Agreement shall renew automatically for one (1) additional three (3) year period (the "Renewal Term" and collectively, together with the Initial Term, the "Term") unless either party provides the other with written notice of non-renewal at least thirty (30) days before the expiration of the Initial Term].
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires a 90-day notice for non-renewal. The modification reduces this to 30 days, which may be insufficient under certain state franchise laws or other regulations that require longer notification periods to protect the interests of parties in ongoing commercial relationships. This is especially true if the agreement is interpreted as a franchise under Nevada law, which can require more extensive notice periods.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state franchise laws or implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, impacting reasonable notice expectations.

perturbation.original_text: As a condition to being furnished with Confidential Information, the Recipient agrees, during the Term and for five (5) years thereafter.
perturbation.changed_text: As a condition to being furnished with Confidential Information, the Recipient agrees to keep the information confidential only for one (1) year after the termination of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text enforces a five-year confidentiality period post-termination. The modification reduces this to one year, potentially inadequate for trade secrets or other highly sensitive information. This could conflict with the Nevada Uniform Trade Secrets Act, which protects trade secrets for as long as they remain secret and provide economic value.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada Uniform Trade Secrets Act and common law principles of trade secret protection.
